definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Demetrious: you are here, my dear Hermia! I found you for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 你在这里，我亲爱的荷米亚，我找你找了好久。

sentences.english: Pushing it softly open and tiptoeing in, I found all quiet inside, and my wife fast asleep.
sentences.chinese: 轻轻地推门进去，什么声息也没有，妻已睡熟好久了。

sentences.english: Nobody has paid a visit to that grave for a long time, so it is covered in weeds.
sentences.chinese: 那座坟丘因为好久没人祭扫，上面长满了野草。

sentences.english: I've been sitting here for hours but the fish aren't biting.
sentences.chinese: 钓鱼人等了好久，可是没有鱼上钩。

sentences.english: If not, when do you plan to start?
sentences.chinese: 如果没有，打算好久开始呢？

sentences.english: I'm anxious to go back home as I've been away for a very long time.
sentences.chinese: 我已经好久没有回家了，此刻真是归心似箭。

sentences.english: Hello, long time no see. How are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 你好，好久不见。你怎么样？

sentences.english: We all smiled. The Cold War seemed a long time ago.
sentences.chinese: 我们都面带微笑，冷战似乎已经过去好久了。

sentences.english: I haven't seen them for many days.
We were sidetracked for a long time and children came and peeked in.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘的火车在旁轨上停了好久，有些儿童进来窥探。

sentences.english: He was thrown roughly into a bed where he remained untended for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他被胡乱地扔到一张床上，好久也没有人护理他。

sentences.english: It took me a long time to answer that I really had no idea and kept shaking my head.
sentences.chinese: 我想了好久，最后一个劲地摇头说，真不知道先救谁。

sentences.english: Suddenly, she kept quiet, standing there for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 她忽然安静了，楞楞地站了好久。

sentences.english: The audience laughed so much that their laughter forced me to run way long.
sentences.chinese: 观众的多次哄堂大笑迫使我在演讲过程中停顿了好久。

sentences.english: Ann, long time no see. Where were you going?
sentences.chinese: 安，好久不见，你去了哪里？

sentences.english: Ben Affleck has had a man crush on Matt Damon for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 本阿弗莱克欣赏马特达蒙好久了。

definition: half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
